field.label: HTTP Listen Address
field.help: Enter a list of IP addresses and ports which can be used in nginx listen directives. To listen on a port on all IPs, use for example "80,[::]:80"

field.label: HTTPS Listen Address
field.help: Enter a list of IP addresses and ports which can be used in nginx listen directives. To listen on a port on all IPs, use for example "443,[::]:443"

field.label: Reject SSL Handshake
field.help: If enabled, TLS handshakes for this server will be rejected.

field.label: PROXY Protocol
field.help: If you enable the proxy protocol, a downstream proxy can send the client IP and port before the real traffic is set.

field.label: Trusted Proxies
field.help: Enter a list of IP addresses or CIDR networks which are allowed to override the source IP address using the specified header.

field.label: Trusted Proxies (Firewall Alias)
field.help: Choose a Firewall Alias for trusted proxies.

field.label: Real IP Source
field.help: X-Real-IP and X-Forwarded-For are HTTP headers, while PROXY protocol is a protocol which needs to be enabled.

field.label: URL Rewriting
field.help: Choose URL rewriting rules.

field.label: Maximum Body Size
field.help: If the request is larger, it will be rejectet with error 413 (Request Entity Too Large). For example, you can enter 200m.

field.label: Body Buffer Size
field.help: If the request exceeds this size, it will be written to disk. Enter a number and a unit like 1m.

field.label: Verify Client Certificate
field.help:
• On: the certificate is requested and validated. Use this option to protect a service with TLS authentication.
  • Off: The certificate is not requested. Choose this option for a normal website.
  • Optional: The certificate is requested and validated if existing. Choose this option for websites, with TLS login support or mixed TLS protected API and web content.
  • Optional, don't verify: Do accept the certificate and let the application choose what to do. Choose this option, for the same reasons as optional but in this case, the request is passed to the backend without rejecting untrusted certificates.

field.label: Zero RTT
field.help: If you enable this feature, your website will may get vulnerable to replay attacks, but you gain a big performance boost. You can read RFC 8446 for more information. The Backend will get a HTTP header "Early-Data" which can be used if a short handshake was used. If a response is too risky, answer with HTTP status code 425.

field.label: Error Log Level
field.help: Select Error Log Level. Log levels are listed in the order of increasing verbosity. Setting a certain log level will cause all messages of the specified and more severe log levels to be logged.

field.label: HTTPS Only
field.help: If you check this box, a TLS encrypted connection is enforced.

field.label: TLS Protocols
field.help: Enable specified protocols. Default: TLSv1.2 TLSv1.3. TLSv1 and TLSv1.1 are insecure and excluded from GUI.

field.label: TLS Ciphers
field.help: Specify enabled ciphers in the TLS library cipher string format. Example: ECDHE-ECDSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256:ECDHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256. NGINX default (empty field): HIGH:!aNULL:!MD5.

field.label: ECDH curve
field.help: Specify a curve(s) for ECDHE ciphers. NGINX default (empty field): auto.

field.label: Prefer server ciphers
field.help: Prefers server ciphers over client ciphers.

field.label: OCSP Stapling
field.help: If you check this box, OCSP stapling is enabled. If your certificate has the TLS feature "status_request" enabled and don't enable OCSP Stapling, you could get an TLS error like "MOZILLA_PKIX_ERROR_REQUIRED_TLS_FEATURE_MISSING". This can be the case if you use Let's Encrypt with "OCSP Must Staple". More information about OCSP stapling can be found in RFC 7633.

field.label: OCSP Verify
field.help: Enables or disables verification of OCSP responses by the server.

field.label: Block Configuration Files
field.help: Blocks files like .htaccess files or other files not intended for the public.

field.label: Disable Bot Protection
field.help: Blocks the request when a possibly bad bot is detected and adds the originating IP to the managed firewall alias for permanent blocking.

field.label: IP ACL
field.help: If you select an IP ACL, the client can only access this service if it fulfills this requirement.

field.label: Advanced ACL Authentication Backend
field.help: Choose a backend for advanced authentication. If you don't have one, configure it under System -> Access -> Servers. If nothing is configured, the local database is used.

field.label: Satisfy
field.help: All: All access restrictions must be fulfilled; Any: Any of the access restrictions must be fulfilled.

field.label: Naxsi Trusted Source IPs
field.help: Enter a list of IP addresses or CIDR networks which will be whitelisted for the Naxsi rules.

field.label: Extensive Naxsi Log
field.help: Provide a more verbose WAF log for fixing false positives before going live.

field.label: Enable Sendfile
field.help: Allow the daemon to use the sendfile function.

field.label: Header Buffer Size (kB)
field.help: Contains the size of a header Buffer. If a header or the request line does not fit into it, a large header buffer will be used.

field.label: Count Of Large Header Buffers
field.help: This field contains the amount of large header buffers. If there are not enough, the server will respond with an HTTP error.

field.label: Size Of Large Header Buffers (kB)
field.help: This field contains the size of large header buffers. If a header or the request line does not fit into it, the server will respond with an HTTP error.

field.label: Limit Requests
field.help: If you choose multiple limits, the strictest will be used.

field.label: Error Pages
field.help: Select custom error pages to display instead of the default builtin error pages. If at least one error page is selected here, all default error pages will be disabled.
